Technique: ROUGH-HEWN; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Ostracon
Description: The recto of this ostracon carries an inscription written in hieratic on four lines. It mentions the titles of the vizier Hori, known from different sources. Stemming from a Memphite family, he  exercised the function of vizier of Lower Egypt under the reign of Sethos II. From the reign of Siptah onwards, Hori was living at Thebes as the vizier of Upper Egypt. He also fulfilled this function under Sethnakt and Ramesses III. The verso contains three hieratic lines written by another hand.
